AuthorsInstructions: Enter a comma-separated list of author names, email, Twitter handle and GitHub username.
DemosInstructions: Quick list of the demos you want to show.
KeywordsInstructions: List of keywords or keyphrases, comma separated.

Links to docs: As part of the preparation, prepare a list of links to the documentation that you will use to prepare the content. These links will be included in the website too.
Links to Learn: As part of the preparation, prepare a list of links to the documentation that you will use to prepare the content. These links will be included in the website too.
Other Links (optional): These can be other links to Microsoft properties or to other sites.

PersonalNotesInstructions: A bullet points list of notes you can use to keep track of things.
PhoneticsInstructions: Add the phonetics of the word or the expression.
ShortDescriptionInstructions: Please keep to about 25 words maximum.
TitleInstructions: This is a template to help you create a synopsis. [You can see an example here](https://aka.ms/glossary/sample/synopsis).
Go to [the instructions to get started with a new term!](https://github.com/lbugnion/ms-glossary/blob/master/instructions/getting-started.md)
TranscriptInstructions: A transcript of what you are planning to say on camera, including demos etc.
When writing your script, and even though we are not working on the video yet, [keep in mind the general structure of the social videos](./getting-started-video.md).

Links to Learn.Text: Refactor Node.js and Express APIs to Serverless APIs with Azure Functions

ShortDescription: an abbreviation meaning Azure Active Directory, a service used to manage identity, authentication and authorization on Microsoft Azure.
Title: test-topic-15
Transcript:
Today's word of the day is: WORD.
Today's words of the day are: EXPRESSION.
Today's word of the day is an abbreviation: ABBREVIATION.

Hello and welcome to Microsoft Azure Words of the Day, the show that teaches you the Azure vocabulary!

> For abbreviations, also mention the full expression in the intro and show phonetics too.
